alert.note: Alert for Carter; Custer; Fallon; Powder River; Rosebud; Treasure (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued May 10 at 2:01AM MDT by NWS Billings
info.description: .A strong storm system will bring heavy rainfall to the area, starting this evening and continuing through Friday night. Rainfall totals in excess of 2 inches are likely through the event, with some locations approaching 3 inches. Heavy rain will cause rivers and streams to rise aggressively, with flooding possible. ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING THROUGH LATE FRIDAY NIGHT... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...Portions of Montana, including the following counties, Big Horn, Carter, Custer, Fallon, Powder River, Rosebud and Treasure. Portions of north central Wyoming, including the following county, Sheridan. * WHEN...From this evening through late Friday night. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Creeks and streams may rise out of their banks. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Over 2 inches of rainfall is possible from tonight through Friday night. This heavy rainfall could cause rivers and streams in the area to rise aggressively and possibly flood. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.

area.areaDesc: Carter; Custer; Fallon; Powder River; Rosebud; Treasure
